title: CUDA 9.1 is not compatible with std::tuple from GCC version >= 6.
body_html:
Any work around?
The video card on my laptop is GTX980M, which seems ONLY supported by Cuda9.1 ... I cannot upgrade to Cuda 9.2 .

  1. However, when I tried
python setup.py build

I got the following ERROR messages:

CMake Error at cmake/public/cuda.cmake:313 (message):
CUDA 9.1 is not compatible with std::tuple from GCC version >= 6. Please
upgrade to CUDA 9.2 or use the following option to use another version (for
example):

-DCUDA_HOST_COMPILER=/usr/bin/gcc-5



2. Then, I tried

$ python setup.py build -DCUDA_HOST_COMPILER=/usr/bin/gcc-5


and got the following ERROR messages:

> WARNING: MKL-DNN is not compiled with Intel MKL small library
> Convolution performance might be suboptimal
> Refer https://github.com/01org/mkl-dnn for detail info
> Building wheel torch-1.0.0a0+e80d1d2
> usage: setup.py [global_opts] cmd1 [cmd1_opts] [cmd2 [cmd2_opts] ...]
>    or: setup.py --help [cmd1 cmd2 ...]
>    or: setup.py --help-commands
>    or: setup.py cmd --help
> 
> error: option -D not recognized



What can I do???


Cheers

body:
Any work around?
The video card on my laptop is GTX980M, which seems ONLY supported by Cuda9.1 ... I cannot upgrade to Cuda 9.2 .


1. However, when I tried 
```
python setup.py build
```

I got the following ERROR messages:

> CMake Error at cmake/public/cuda.cmake:313 (message):
>   CUDA 9.1 is not compatible with std::tuple from GCC version >= 6.  Please
>   upgrade to CUDA 9.2 or use the following option to use another version (for
>   example):
> 
>     -DCUDA_HOST_COMPILER=/usr/bin/gcc-5

```


2. Then, I tried

```
$ python setup.py build -DCUDA_HOST_COMPILER=/usr/bin/gcc-5
```

and got the following ERROR messages:

> WARNING: MKL-DNN is not compiled with Intel MKL small library
> Convolution performance might be suboptimal
> Refer https://github.com/01org/mkl-dnn for detail info
> Building wheel torch-1.0.0a0+e80d1d2
> usage: setup.py [global_opts] cmd1 [cmd1_opts] [cmd2 [cmd2_opts] ...]
>    or: setup.py --help [cmd1 cmd2 ...]
>    or: setup.py --help-commands
>    or: setup.py cmd --help
> 
> error: option -D not recognized



What can I do???


Cheers
